page.title: 13LANDSCAPE
page.content: RURAL Over 70% of the landscape is rural; the horizon is broken by woods, copses and thickets in all directions with the occasional farm or other isolated house appearing. To the south it is mainly flat farmland. INDUSTRIAL The skyline is broken to the north by the silhouettes of the buildings of B.N.F.L. Salwick which is in blocks 31 46 and 31 47.A sign of past industry is the Clifton windmill, in 31 46 and the station at Salwick is on the northern boundary on line 32, E of 46. DEVELOPMENTAL The houses of Newton occupy most of the N.E.of 31 44 and the N.W. of 30 45, there being just under 400 houses there.At Clifton there are just over 200 houses; nearly all are in 30 46. Lea town has just over 30 houses .
